intro: Cheiranthus erysimoides, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to regions of Europe, North Africa, and western Asia, often found in rocky or limestone habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are pinnately lobed and simple, alternate leaves above. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and arranged in racemes, blooming in early spring. Cheiranthus erysimoides is characterized by its ability to thrive in harsh environments and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value.
